title: Love it
comment: Works and more. Haven't had an issue yet.

title: Works with tvmc fire stick
comment: The fire stick remote works just fine with kodi, but it's still nice to control xbmc and see what's playing from my tablet. It also gives quick access to addons.
Remote works great so far. Would be 5 stars if it included an integrated keyboard for searches.
So far so good. But! Is there a keyboard to search?

title: Wow
comment: This app is just amazing. The previous official xbmc app was extremely buggy and hard to use. This app is not only superior in every way bit it also has tons of extra features like the send to kodi from youtube which I truly love. If you have kodi; this is a must.

title: Wonderful App!
comment: I use this with multiple Raspberry Pi Kodi media centers around the house all streaming from a FreeNAS machine. It is amazing. I love this app!
Worked perfectly with my Raspberry Pi running OSMC, setting it up was also surprisingly easy and didn't require any changes to the settings on the Pi.

title: Good app
comment: I would like to see support for subtitles

title: Great app
comment: Such an amazing app. It works perfectly with Kodi.

title: Cool, but...
comment: Please include keyboard to be able to browse movies/YouTube easily!
Finally a Kodi remote to go toe-to-toe with Plex. Well done Kodi team!

title: useless for browsing files
comment: the filename is truncated no matter the screen orientation, even on a tablet, when browsing files.  there is no way to change from "content" view where items are in rectangles to a normal list view so you can read what's there.

title: Convenient but should be abke to type from from
comment: We should be able to use the phones keypad to search names etc

title: This is an upgrade!
comment: Last time I used the official XBMC remote it was very basic and ugly. This is incredible! Loving it.

title: Great but needs work.
comment: I'll bump the rating up to 5 stars when you add a keyboard to the remote. Typing with my phone would be a lot easier than navigating the letters on the screen with arrows.

title: Very Good
comment: Been using another remote which keeps shutting down. This one much better.

comment: Now just port it to the builtin html remote

title: Great

title: It has no equal not even close
comment: Congratulations for another great app I swear by kodi it the only media player I use and I have it on 8 devices

comment: Great remote app, very quick and smooth. A widget would be cool if that's possible.

title: Best remote
comment: Dont foget to Support the cause. Donate if you can
Couldn't find my pc

title: Best remote
comment: This is the best free remote that I have found for use with my raspberry pi with raspbmc. It's very responsive and has amazing features. Only issues are that it has a tendency to disconnect sometimes, but removing the media center and re-adding it usually works... And file sizes show as KB when they are actually MB, but that doesn't affect usability. Definitely worth a download and by far my favorite.

title: Copy of yatse but with less functions and more bugs. Just get yatse
comment: Thought this better than yatse Lol no it isn't. Can't we make yatse official Kofi remote?? I think we should

title: Works just the way it should with openelec :D
comment: Fantastic, there is no delay! Loved it!

title: Superb.. The best multimedia center and remote ever!!
comment: The design is superb, intuitive.. Everything works smoothly. So convenient

title: Great but needs lock screen access
comment: Of the app had lock screen access the app would be even better!

title: Works well except for one MAJOR PROBLEM
comment: It doesn't connect when Kodi is restarted. The only way I have found to bypass this issue is to uninstall and then reinstall the app every time. Very annoying!

title: Keyboard?
comment: Kind of useless for me if there's no keyboard...

title: Pretty good!
comment: But not enough to make me switch apps yet! Yatse is still #1

title: sweet control of my mini pc on my tv using my phone
comment: very well done

title: Excellent for Xpenence1080p+
comment: It's only missing a vibration, otherwise its perfect!

title: Great Missing One Function
comment: Great app and remote for Kodi. Wish there was a keyboard for when needing to input letters.

title: Very Good App. Prefer this over Yatse
comment: I found this an excellent app to use for the past few months. I prefer it over Yatse and my Minix keyboard airmouse. As one user mentioned the keyboard failed to show about a week ago but I deleted the app cache/data and forced close and no issues since. Brilliant app.

title: A good start
comment: Works well,, but no live tv settings. Would be nice to be able to scroll live pvt channels that have been configured an loaded and also possibly creat a local lost of prefered channels on the remote itself.

title: Features addition
comment: Need to add the feature to toggle kodi  window or full screen setting..

title: Great app
comment: Had issues with port 80 but as soon a I went above port 20000 which are rarely used by other programs I had no issues. Great app.

title: Inconsistent
comment: Originally when I downloaded this it worked great, but for the last few weeks it has been very inconsistent with connecting to Kodi/XBMC. Yatse still works every time but I do like the UI of Kore more, hopefully it will be fixed soon. When it's working properly it's definitely one of the easiest, straight forward Kodi remotes I've used to date. 3/5 due to inconsistencies, otherwise it'd be a 5/5.
Brilliant

title: Media must have
comment: Xbmc is the best media program on the market and its free. Yes , the best ,at the best price. This is how all software should be made . The example that we all should follow and appreciate.

title: Great!
comment: Does it support every feature of Kodi? No. Is it functional, pretty, and sufficient for daily use? Yes. Does it pass the significant other test? Perfectly. Well done, looking forward to what you roll in next.

title: Love it
comment: Love it
Brilliant app...but please add voice search abilities! Typing on a screen can be tedious sometimes! Keep up the good work.
Hadn't checked out this stuff since XMBC. It was great even then, now this is awesome!

title: Needs widgets
comment: Toggle full screen doesn't work with xbmc 12.3 just changes back to movie list instead of switching to full screen on pc, also needs widgets so you can use player controls without going into main app.

title: Great app
comment: Nice replacement to the old official XBMC Remote App. The one thing that the old App had was a large Remote Widget. Would love to see a Widget added!

title: Can't even touch Yatse
comment: It is very disappointing that this is the official app of kodi when yatse is way more user friendly and 1000x easier on the eyes. Kore is only useful for the arrow keys when it comes to addons. Do yourself a favor and use yatse and not this. Step your game up
Just GREAT Now I can manage my 3 raspberry pi with Kody (XBMC) without any additional remote. Just with the mobile!!!! GREAT GREAT GREAT

title: As simple as it gets
comment: Very easy and user friendly

title: Finally
comment: Finally made it to Mainstream... Long live XBMC

title: Has potential
comment: Would rate 5 if it didn't keep bloody freezing!

title: good start but yatse still does it better
comment: lacks important features like proper Kodi addon control support

title: The best.
comment: This combined with XBMC on XUbuntu is the greatest multimedia experience I have ever had. Even above foobar2000 on my workstation PC. Quick, responsive, beautiful, organised, simple, easy setup and use. All around a fantastic experience!

title: Amazing
comment: Works well for my usage. Definately a welcome complement to my kodi htpc. Easiest setup ever and user friendly. Thank you for the app

title: Good, solid remote for Kodi
comment: While not the most feature-rich remote available for Kodi, it does everything you need for normal use and it does it well.

title: Awesome
comment: Works perfectly

I really wanted to love this app but one bad bug ruins the whole experience - When I access and play a video using navigation buttons the on-screen media bar shows up but it doesn't let me control the playback (i cannot even stop the playback). I have to go to my PC to stop the video and then restart kore remote to get back the navigation buttons.  I will be more than happy to rate kore 5 stars if the above is fixed.  Some reviews mentioned how good the 'non-official' remote called "yatse" is. I installed yatse and it has been great so far.

title: Better than the last one
comment: This is far more polished and user friendly than the previous xbmc remote, but I would like to see a "skip forward 30 seconds button" that is usually the right arrow key.

title: Works great but fails sometimes
comment: When it works, its amazing but it has some flaws. Biggest problem I have that it does not connect to kodi sometimes.

title: always have n always will be a HUUUUUGE fan
comment: XBMC/Kodi.. 10 or more years ago,I could write/design a skin for any available xbox app, or even xbmc going vice versa,using a virtual keyboard and a game controller 🎮, then when I finally gave in n plugged my puter into my telly,still using xbmc, 4 windows,I bought a usb controller, very similar in style,still sweet,then came the update after Gotham,n no more😲 yatse is great,but knowing the white button gets u t ur play list,n yellow queues nxt track,or deletes it from plylist screen was priceless!

title: Works perfectly on Note 4.
comment: An incredible app, that gives you full control over Kodi, and has very convenient features like browsing the menu of add ons with out bringing the GUI onto the TV. I also love the power features for my computer, such as sleep, wake, restart and power off. Fantastic app!

title: Very nice. Please add profile switching
comment: Great way to use Kodi. I almost don't need the display. I'd like to be able to switch profiles without turning on the display. The plan is to have one profile for one HDMI output (TV), and another profile for another output that's audio only. At the moment, I need to turn on the TV just to listen to music.
One of if not the best Kodi remotes.

title: great but missing the widgets
comment: I will change it to 5 starts after they add the widgets back

title: No Keyboard?
comment: If it's there is not very obvious. If not, well that's quite an oversight, nobody likes to traverse the on screen keyboard using a remote control.
Great app by XBMC guys, it looks perfect but lacking 1 important feature, i.e the ability to directly stream movies from PC.

title: Love it!!
comment: Works perfect on S5 running Kodi isengard b2.  Thank you!!!!

title: Still not same level as Xbmc old app
comment: Slow reaction from arrows. Chapter selection in TV shows not as intuitive, too many clicks to arrive to desired chapter. Still to be improved.

title: Great app
comment: It takes the official team to build the best remote app. Apart from a glitch I had once where the app wouldn't load my library until I restated the app, it has been perfect.

title: Brilliant
comment: Love the app, now I don't have to get up to change the walking Dead episode, 100% lazy mode now ,thanks!

title: Almost all functionality needed

title: Excellent job !
comment: Very good apps, makes my life more easier when watching on my Android TV box. 2 thumbs up !!!.

title: A+

title: Nice control
comment: I like it

title: Good but need some features
comment: Its disconnect from time, if you can change the arrow or add for a full TouchPad that will be great.

title: Clever stuff!
comment: I don't normally rate apps, but I've gotta say, job well done guys!  Piece of cake to set up and seamless and intuitive to use, it turns my phone into the ultimate Kodi remote and movie companion.  Love it.

title: Almost there
comment: A very nice update to the remote. Nice fresh and clean interface and only two small issues I have experienced. I have two profiles but cannot login on restart of the htpc as the app does not connect. Old remote threw an error but still allowed me access to the remote to select a profile and login. Also, when I select a TV series with multiple seasons I don't want season 1 expanded by default. I'd like them all collapsed please.

title: It is greate
comment: Would love to some widgets!

title: Kore needs a keyboard
comment: Please add a keyboard!!!  a keyboard would help and make this app 5 🌟!!  Using the arrows on a virtual keyboard on the screen of my TV is the only complaint one can really make about this app. Other then that, this app is awesome, thank you

title: Arrows
comment: Please make the arrows work like the keyboard... Going forward or backwards is very handy

title: This plus pi2
comment: Joined together with openSuSE JeOS is pure perfectness.

title: Excellent App
comment: Gave it 5 stars because it works perfectly and is very well designed. Some extra features like one key access to tv guide would be nice.
The message "Your library is being synced", displayed right after setup, without me asking it to do so freaked me out earlier. Other than that the app's fine.
What are you talking about !? It doesn't upload anything to Kodi, it just downloads your library info to your phone so you can browse it on the phone.
Arrow buttons don't work how they did before and how they do on a keyboard. Buttons reordered from previous layout for no apparent reason, screwing with muscle memory.

title: Brilliant.
comment: I've been using Android for probably a bit over five years and in that time I've probay reviewed one app. Kore is so good that I need to.  Fantastic design, amazing way to view titles in your collection, a nice big 'play' button on title screens, easy access to addons - just about everything you could want. The only thing missing is a nice simple way to bring up the context menu - I know I've done it before but would prefer a more obvious option to do so somewhere. Otherwise, it just couldn't be better!!

title: Pretty great
comment: Was using yatse but this feels more like a material design xbmc app. The issue I have with it is the speed of going next on a list it seems to have a cap that is to low. Other than that it is a great xbmc/kodi remote.

title: Improved look and feel but glitchy.
comment: The interface is cleaner and a bit more intuitive than XBMC. (The design and navigation could be more Apple and less Linux, if you know what I mean.) Unfortunately, a critical function - the arrow controls work part time. It seems you can navigate the on screen menus, etc, but as soon as you have a show running the arrows stop working for the purpose of navigating the show.

title: Excellent
comment: Works great looks nice.

title: Jared
comment: It's missing critical functionality and until then it gets 2 stars as being hardly worth using. The arrow keys do not skip 30s/10m and do nothing instead. It only gets the 2 stars because of the potential it has, but right now it's not really usable.

title: Always had remote problems until now
comment: I have always had trouble getting remotes to work with my system, but Kore worked as soon as I had changed the default port away from 80. The only thing I can fault it on is that it takes me into Videos, TV Shows, and Music Library, but I would like to be able to customise those options for my system.
Needs better support for long file names

title: Can not find the server
comment: No info of port on the server side

title: Works great on Galaxy Note 4!
comment: When watching a movie or series swipe from left to right to see a synopsis of what your watching and also greater control of forwarding,  pausing the movie.   The main screen with the arrows only does so much. I was hesitant in making the move to this from the original xbmc remote.   However,  I don't use anything else now.   This does it all flawlessly!
Think its great as i use kodi on my PC and now i have a fully functioning remote that works perfectly

title: La mejor idea
comment: Best idea, don't need to purchase remote

title: Copy of yatse

Needs a lot of work. Can't search files, does not show full file names. Stick with Yatse.

title: Awesome!
comment: I love this remote. Get it.

title: No resume of videos?
comment: App is very clean but missing a few key features that every xbmc remote should have. The big one keeping me from switching from yahtse is not being able to start movies where I left off.

title: Needs a on screen keyboard
comment: Only thing i miss is an on screen keyboard button instead of using the d-pad on the phone.

title: Misses vital features
comment: File browser doesn't show full file names, so there is no way to actually know what you are playing next. And more importantly, what you have already watched should be marked with a check mark, but it isn't. Yatse does it better.

title: Best App Ever
comment: Flawless movies and wonderful music among other stuff

title: What a clean design!
comment: Wow so clean and well organized... Excellent discovery of servers (my wife always struggled to remember IP addresses)  Texting feature is great too... No more yelling down the stairs for the kids to come up for dinner!  Kudos for Kodi!

title: Best remote for best HTPC

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: The app is pretty good, beautiful fresh UI, and easy to use and connect. Still, it lacks some features of Yatse, which I'm accustomed to. Keeping it installed, hope to see it improved.

title: Why
comment: This is useless, why would anyone use this apps, when you have yatse, good job it was free, which is still too much....

title: It's no Yatse...
comment: but it's a hell of a lot better than the old official remote and being open source means it has a lot of potential. Right now a lot of functionality is still missing, maybe in a year or so.

title: Great apps for kodi
comment: Most suitable apps for kodi remote so far I found. Easy to navigate and text input

title: Browsing By files is needs some love.
comment: I like the fact you seem to have fix the two big issues I had with the XBMC remote, rotate while viewing files and the remote getting stuck.    But the file browser needs to show more of the file name and the rotate should show 1 column,  I rotate my phone to see more info.   This has made me continue to use the XBMC Remote.    Fix these issues and I will gladdy give it another try.      P.S.   Like the filtering of .xml files.
Toggle full screen is not working after the updates. Other than that this app is awesome

title: Appealing and do the job
comment: Used to interface with an odroid-c1, work like a charm. Good job guys
Not as good as Yatse

title: The old app was better
comment: The UI is nice to look at, but the old app worked better. Here sources are sorted randomly, buttons on the remote don't work properly. Can't seek with left/right/up/down buttons. Back button doesn't rewind by 7 seconds... In short I'm dissapointed.
Must add chromecast streaming

title: Fantastic app
comment: This with KODI on the Pi 2 and you have the perfect media centre. 5 stars easy.

title: Decent,but needs work
comment: Decent remote, but TV episodes do not show if the are in sperate season folders, the remote needs a swipe option rather than just buttons. The developers should look at the yatse remote for a few ideas to make this better.

title: Good stuff but important function missing
comment: In usual scenario when connecting with computer. There is no way to edit connection option. This is important as PC IP will change every time with restart and there is no other option then to clear app data. Update: thanks for providing the location to edit server list. Please include this on Context menu as well. Using host name didn't work. Also I tried installing Bonjour that didn't help in remote as well.

You can edit the connection info for each Kodi instance. In the media centers list there's the option to edit each one. Instead of entering the IP you should try entering the hostname to check if that works.

title: Nice, needs a little improving.
comment: I think it needs bigger buttons like the original, sometimes my hand touch's another button by mistake. But otherwise nice update...

title: Good work.
comment: It very well though its hard to figure out how to cofigure it.i did it manually.
Shaiye

title: The wait is over.
comment: It has been worth the wait but finally I have an app that looks good, works and has the functionality I have been waiting for.

title: Good but always room for improvement
comment: Love the interface, the best remote I've used.  The video download option doesn't seem to work for me I'm not sure if anyone else has the same issue. When trying to download from my mint 17.1 box running xbmc Gotham to my nexus7 2013 android 5.1 it fails immediately.  It would also be nice to view videos by genre.  Over all fantastic keep it up!

title: Goť nothing on Yatse
comment: Good simple alternative if Yatse is to much for u to handle ;)

title: Missing genres
comment: Love the design and the fact we can see the shows and thumbnails offline. I miss the genre filter available on the old xbmc remote, it is very useful with large libraries. The app works like a charm on my S5 running KitKat, the only way I can get it to work on my Nexus 5 running Lollipop is to manually config it turnibg off TCP.

title: No widget
comment: Great app compare to previous xbmc remote app. The only missing part is an android widget. It was so handy. Switching back to old xbmc remote until have widget support in this one.

title: Works as advertised
comment: I love the concept of using XBMC without keyboard but an android remote. After installing this app, I do not connect keyboards to Raspberry Pi running OSMC Kodi

title: Is better than using my amazon fire stick remote.. a must have for kodi.

comment: Better than the old XBMC app, more modern and visually appealing

title: Not bad, but needs work.
comment: Much like previous "official" remote apps for kodi/xbmc, this works, but the lack of "love" for the app by the developer is plain to see. Also, the "swipe down to update" feature doesn't work properly for artists or albums on the Sony Xperia Z1C in this version. Now playing toggle buttons like shuffle and mute, etc also lag or get stuck. On the upside it's less complicated than some other remote control apps I've used.

title: So smooth!
comment: Must have for any kodi user.

title: Very nice app
comment: Would love android wear support

title: Easy, simple and powerful.
comment: I'd love to see a feature where you just have to swipe to go up, down, left and right. Instead of pishing the buttons on the dpad.

title: Good but...
comment: Well done but too bad the arrows are not working like on the keyboard. That's something i always used since man years on xbmc. Its so convenient.

title: Great app
comment: It would be perfect if the gesture part of the remote would be added.

title: Add-on section not working
comment: Add-on section doesn't allow to use the add-on remotely

title: wow
comment: amazing app, im new to kodi but this app was up and running as soon as it was installed no setup required. also it works really well

title: Great Remote
comment: Been using this for a few days now. Does everything I need it to do. An improvement would be having a keyboard instead of navigating the keyboard on the tv.
Keyboard is in the remote screen, under the top right menu, option "Send text to media center"
Kodi/xbmc rocks.

title: Perfect Kodi companion
comment: This remote is exactly what I was waiting for. Wish it had a touch screen function for a cursor.

title: Not impressive
comment: It cannot stop the in progress YouTube video and start a new one. Need to stop the video manually and start a new one. Yatse is the best.

title: Really great.
comment: It would be great if it allowed me to browse the library of a video addon from the app while video is still playing on Kodi. I know that if I configure library integration with my favourite addons, I'll get some of that functionality.   That's a small ask, though. This works really well as a Kodi remote.

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome remote, it has less feature than yatse but it has just what I need. Great job.

title: Almost the complete package
comment: Big improvement over the previous official remote.  It would be great to be able to change the sort order for the listings.  e.g. Sort albums by year or recently added.

title: Looks great, but needs a few features.
comment: There needs to be a a way to scrub video and change audio languages/ subtitles from the app. It can be done in Yatse.

title: Works great, much more interactive than previous verion
comment: The text box and keyboard pop up immediately in the app when it pops on the kodi application.

title: Very clean and simple
comment: Clear and works well

title: It just works!
comment: Does everything it says on the box.  It works. No mucking around and no weird setup required.

title: Very well polished
comment: Awesome, well polished app for Kodi. I'm loving it because they've come a long way and have arrived with something very nice. It's not perfect because nothing but Jesus is. If you have Kodi give it the remove a shot.
Fab little remote app! A good widget would be a 5 star rating

title: Not yatse but nice still
comment: Nice remote app,  definitely second nicest option available.  At the end of the day this is a less featured version of yatse,  but being that it's free this is still a great value..

title: Needs Skip Forward
comment: Nice app, but really missing the 30 second / 10 minute skip options by using the forward and up arrows on the 4-way controlled.  Otherwise, a very nice app.

title: Beautiful,  but lacking
comment: It looks fantastic, but some features are missing like ability to search songs by title. Will use yatse until they update this app.

title: Works as advertised
comment: Nice and easy to use

title: Better Kodi remote to date
comment: Clean UI, useful information displayed on every media displayed.
Awesome. It took a while for me to find an that worked and was easy to setup. Found it!!

title: I love it, but...
comment: We need the key pad number and pvr option like yatse.  Thank you
It cant find my kodi and even when i enter it manually it still cant find it

title: It's an improvement but it's not Yatse
comment: And it looks like it copied Yatse in almost every department... Why didn't you work out a deal with Yatse? It could have been the best official remote ever...

title: Great improves
comment: I loved this new version, work great on lollipop. Kodi is the best media center ever. Some notifications don't show, like Google plus, but I hope this work on the future

title: Works great
comment: The only problem for me is Wake on Lan, which isn't working for me  in this app (it works in the older xbmc remote).  One minor thing is also that in order to update a configuration change for a host, it needs to be responding. Which isn't always desirable (e.g when trying to change the wake on lan and not able to save the config to test it)
Works flawlessly moto g gen1. Thanks

title: Good but issues after last update
comment: Very good app, but last update broke the notification control for me. I tried reinstalling but still not working. Please fix.

title: Love it
comment: Very easy to set it up. Love it

title: Not bad
comment: Not bad but yatse is still a bit better. Good work, much better than the previous one but still too far from perfect... If you will just use movie sets and ignore "the" in names i will use you

title: Good
comment: Very great apps

title: Beautiful
comment: Absolutely stunning. For too long, Kodi has lacked a truly worthy official remote. Kore ticks all the boxes. Sleek and minimal but elegant design in parallel with unbelievably fast synchronising. Love it.

title: Awesome remote
comment: The more I use it the more I am loving this remote.  Has most of the features that I was hoping the other third party remotes had.
Neat and quick app

title: Fix
comment: People are saying they can't connect. It's probably because some keyboards enter a white space after typing the IP address. Works without the white space.

title: Works well
comment: Works well. Only thing is the list of TV shows on app doesn't show up. The movies do so am puzzled
No keyboard

title: This won't work.
comment: I entered everything correctly, still don't work

title: A great update!
comment: Looks like Yatse has some real competition now!

title: Much improved app
comment: Well done

title: Improvement
comment: Definitely better than the old official xbmc remote as that was pretty much terrible which was why everyone used Yatse, this remote is a big time improvement, simple but clean and functional, a widget would be nice & WOL to power up kodi Just recently started using kodi and it's a nice interface but leaves alot to be desired, they keep updating all the time but to be honest considering how long it has been around you would think a web browser and a good email client capable of connecting to outlook/hotmail.

title: Excellent remote
comment: This works perfectly with obmc for the Raspberry Pi B+.

title: Fantastic accompanying tool to the already perfect KODI!
comment: Set up a raspberry pi 2 with OpenElec. Using this app makes things even easier!
Works great and looks amazing. I wish the iPad app looked this good. Hopefully they will update it eventually.
Cant really fault it, has every feature I can think of and works perfectly, even on a bad connection.

title: Beautiful, elegant, modern... and works like a charm!
comment: A fantastically well written app that is fully featured, looks amazing, and handles any errors that might pop up pretty gracefully. By far the new king of the hill when it comes to remote control apps for Kodi!
Works great, no ads and has MD look

title: Beautiful!
comment: Absolutely amazing design and aesthetics - just need to be able to sort ignoring article e.g. "The"

title: Great Remote
comment: Beautiful design and extremely easy to set up. Kudos to the developer.

title: Great!
comment: Working with raspberry pi2 perfectly. Great app!

title: Wont connect
comment: Configured to exactly what your directions say multiple times, recognizes the media center but wont connect, keeps telling me to check configuration. Theres nothing else i can do help!

title: well done
comment: i love the youtube sharing feature

title: Love the Material Design
comment: This is the best looking Kodi Remote app on the Play Store! I just wish it had streaming support for local play and Chromecast etc.

title: Great app
comment: Yatse became the second favorite

title: please update
comment: Please add keyboard and mouse, ang its perfect!
Very good

title: Recommended.
comment: After having some issues with yatse I decided to give Kore another go. Much better than it used to be.

title: Great!
comment: Much better than the previous official one. Huge step forward. A please to use. Thank you!

title: Clean and simple
comment: Fantastic official kodi remote app. Beautiful material design and super smooth to use.

title: Simply Amazing!
comment: Works Perfectly Fine... WOL feature Is just Ideal and deserves a recognition. In the future I'd like to see Widgets and Volume feature on the Notification drop down or more customizable. Cheers!

title: Great companion app
comment: Design is awesome, really easy to use, and layout is very intuitive. Would like to see the ability to change between list and tile for the music playlist and add music ratings.

title: Purpose
comment: Serves it's purpose as a remote controller, and then some; very cool.  Thanks xbmc

title: Intermintantly
comment: Its fine when it works...

title: Good but, not as feature filled as Yaste
comment: It is slim and much more responsive than the old official one. But it lacks features I use from Yaste like play locally, and share to Kodi. Its a good start.

title: Swany57
comment: Easy setup works like a charm

title: Kore
comment: Pretty good app.

title: Great remote
comment: A fantastic remote with a great look and fantastic functionality beyond just play, pause, fast forward etc.  Highly recommended.

title: Pretty and all...
comment: ...but the app misses a lot of functionality of the XBMC remote. The loss of haptic feedback is a big miss. The functional buttons on the remote don't work as well either.  So all in all, I used it for a bit, but went back to the old app. If the functionality of that was put into this, then I would definitely use this.  (Nexus 6 and Kodi on RPi)

title: Works Great on a Nexus7 & a GS3
comment: Great program for controlling your Kodi/XBMC entertainment system. If you're having trouble connecting your devices  go into your Kodi/XBMC system settings & highlight the little circles that allow access by remote control.

title: Can't configure it out
comment: I give up. I even installed the Avahi file which supposedly configures automatically. Really? Goodbye, Kore. It was...
Yatse is much better.

title: Great app
comment: Only one thing I would change. The movie seek bar is very hard to control,  if it were to able scrub slower while showing the time which you're passing it would be perfect.

title: Great remote.
comment: Lovely Design and kept nice and simple but doesn't come with any widgets so I won't be using it.

title: the best !!!
comment: easy to use
Excellent considering it is for free. Thanks
The nuts
Amazing!

title: Love it
comment: App works great. Connects every time all ways work.. I just wish when trying to cue a song the button was a bit bigger for us people with big fingers.

title: Perfect
comment: No problems with it and easy to setup.
Problem connecting

title: Unable to control add-ons
comment: Great remote control app for Kodi, but unfortunately doesn't allow me to start and play from a music or video add-on.
Needs a widget

title: Very slim and fast, unfortunately missing some features
comment: Yatse still beats this for me, I'm missing a couple of button(s and) functions such as skipping through a video with the up,dn,left,right buttons. And toggling fullscreen/overlay without having to jump through a menu first. Yatse's navigation keys are also bigger which is nice even on my 5" moto g panel. Being able to send video URLs to Kodi from the Android share menu would be nice.

title: Very slick
comment: Awesome app, pulls in all the meta from the server. Very clean.

title: Nice app!
comment: Works perfectly.

title: Looks good, lacks functionality
comment: Lacking functionality that is found in the original XBMC remote. Vibration on press, left/right should be short step advance/rewind, a stop button on the main remote screen. Would like to see the ability to display notifications from selected apps.

title: Beautiful App That Works
comment: Just switched from the old XBMC app. This is fully functional and a very nice looking app.
I really miss using the arrow keys for the 30 second skips.

title: No more 30 sec skip = 3 stars
comment: Come on. Why did you remove the 30 seconds skip?! Put it back ASAP. Then, I will be able to give 5 stars. Until then, it's just not honest to rate the app any higher.

title: Great!
comment: Great app but really need haptic feedback, I'm so clumsy and most of the time I'm looking at the Tele!

title: Playlist
comment: This is brilliant, I have 3 media centers, living room, bedroom, kids bedroom and have it setup for all of them. Would it be possible to save a playlist from the phone?

title: Its OK
comment: As a remote control but it will not play the media from kodi onto your phone or tablet. No addons good app but needs work. Thanks

title: Nothing like Yaste
comment: Tried it... Deleted it. Going back to yaste.

title: shaping up to be real nice
comment: App is currently very nice.  Looking forward to more updates.

title: Awesomeness in the making
comment: The potential is clearly visible, I only expect it to get better over time even though it's already great.

title: Missing something
comment: Need to add functionality to fling YouTube and other streams to kodi. Otherwise, definitely a step up from the old official remote app. Adding this will make this as good as yatse

title: Great app
comment: Glad to see there is an official version of kodi remote. I would love to a track pad option.

title: Chromecast
comment: Please add Chromecast support.

title: Awesome
comment: Makes accessing shows, movies etc, so easy.  Even my wife loves it.   Had it connected in less than 2 minutes.  I love seeing the pictures of the movies and shows.  Click once and the video plays on my tv.  Awesome work DEV's
Perfect

title: Good
comment: Definitely better looking than Yatse, but needs Wear support

title: Add EPG feature.
comment: Awesome app, now I only needs EPG browser to see what's on.
Brilliant

title: Doesn't connect...
comment: It had connected to update now no go

title: Almost there
comment: Much nicer and cleaner than yatse, but needs an alternative to xmbcstarter or make it work
When I first saw XBMC I said: This is an amazing program! Kodi and Kore now rule my cloud media experience.

title: WOL fixed, raising to 5 stars
comment: Everything works, now including WOL. Great clean app.

title: Awesome
comment: The XBMC Remote deserved an update and you guys delivered. Way to go! This is so much easier to use.

title: Ignore all the imitations!
comment: Run everything from your phone including addons!

title: Years behind Yatse
comment: It works of course but many crucial functions are missing. Yatse is almost flawless.

title: 1.3 Update is Amazing
comment: The file list makes this remote so much easier to use. It is a little difficult to scroll down a long list on a TV screen with the arrow button because there's no physical guidance to keep one's finger centered. Being able to look at the phone to see the list is so much better. Add Android Wear support so I can pause playback from my watch, and I'd give it 6 stars.

title: They actually made it worse than it was before.
comment: They fixed the "Toggle Fullscreen" bug, but now the remote drops the connection every few seconds and has to reconnect. Also, how do the up/down/left/right controls not perform the jump forward/back actions? So, if I want to jump back 30 seconds, I have to rewind, then pray to the Flying Spaghetti Monster that the remote doesn't drop it's connection before I need to hit Play. This app is completely unusable. I hope it gets better, but until then I don't see any reason to stop using Yatse.

title: Too hard to install
comment: Needs to be easier setup. Could not find my media center.

title: Love it
comment: I really liked the old remote, and I was kinda worried of changing it, but after 2 minutes of use, I just love it. Nice UX with some clever materialish improvements!

title: I am happy with it
comment: I was disappointed that volume icons on Yatse remote did not work well. This application does the basics without any problem, so it gets better review. Thanks!

title: Awesome
comment: Great functionality.
Looks good, BUT I am using it to watch my saved series... and all the ones that have more than one season have all the episodes doubled?

title: Well presented!
comment: Lacks PVR!

title: Excellent
comment: I never use Music or Add-on sections, so it'd be nice to have the option to remove them from the menu. Also to be able to set the media lists to grid view.

title: Ok
comment: I like the app but it will be more useful if I can use it to open the addon, tv show, episode instead of just going to the menu and having to get to it the long way. Or give a way to pick our favorites from here.  Thank you for your hard work.

title: Great app
comment: Kore is a beautiful and functional app. Only thing I rally miss is the "send to Kodi" functionality Yatse offers. Hope you add this soon and I will add the missing star.

title: Great just great
comment: Absolutely fantastic. Running OSMC on a raspberry pi2 with a stunning performance and with kore app, and this is exactly media center and library management I had in my mind.

title: Nice
comment: Excellent remote! Needs a widget though!

title: Keyboard
comment: Need the option to use a qwerty keyboard
Could use number pad for entering TV channels.
Loving it

title: Good but missing media streaming
comment: This app is the second best remote after Tatse. Just missing streaming options to view and listen to content on other devices.
App is a little off. App keeps popping up

title: Better than the last official remote
comment: But still lacks compared to Yatse or music pump
Great peace of software
Works really good

title: Skip ahead
comment: Pressing right (or up) on the remote doesn't skip ahead anymore. Seems like a big thing to leave out.

title: Great
comment: Perfect. And beautiful, too.

title: Still unreliable after all these years
comment: Got this to connect exactly one time. Fiddled around for a weekend, including complete system resets, etc. Nothing. It's a good thing Kodi is free because it isn't even worth that much.

title: Awesome
comment: Works great on linux mint cinnamon

title: Excellent
comment: Top-notch.  I would like to be able to filter/group by genre but this is an excellent app

title: Great Update
comment: Much better than the old one #YearOfTheCouchPotato

title: Connection issues
comment: It detected and connected to my kodi 14.2rc openelec 5.0.6 on a raspberry pi 2. When I try to use the remote it loses connection and says that its connecting every 2 seconds, like clockwork. I have several iOS devices that connect using the official remote software and control my media center without issue. Installed on nexus 7, android 5.1

title: Congrats!
comment: Good job making it as official. I prefer Kore's basic, slim look and feel. Very easy to set up and use too.
I like the new official remote. Looks good works better then the old one. I do miss the pause playback when I get a call feature though would be nice to have it in this app.

title: Great Remote
comment: Looks great and works well with both my Raspberry Pi and Windows Kodi Media Players.  Great work

title: Excellent Remote
comment: It looks good and does the job extremely well. No complaints or issues from me
It'd be nice if you added vibration when you use remote.

title: Great app
comment: Way friendlier developer than yatzee developer, way better application.  Kodi made the better choice choosing this app as their official.

title: Thank you guys sooooo much.
comment: Finally a remote that works. Great job guys. Happy happy happy.:-)

title: Works with pi
comment: Amazing
Do not like this... All movies not listed, can't skip through now playing movie, remote looks blah...

title: Response Time
comment: The response time when you click a button is tooooo slow plz make it quicker otherwise it would be a good app.

Compared to Yatze, this app is my preferred remote for Modi. Much better interface, but it lacks an on-screen keyboard. Also, it's open source and it has no features you have to unlock with a paid version.
In the menu on the top right corner there's an option to "Send text to xbmc" which opens the on-screen keyboard.

title: Nice Start
comment: For as much as Yatse does, I would hope that we get a lot more features in the coming releases of Kore!

title: Great
comment: Prefer the layout and look of this to yatse, also a lot smoother when scrolling through movies and music. 1 problem with music is you click on some artists and it says no albums found. It should just list all songs from that artist. Would be good to have a tab to list all songs.
Great

title: Only if i can download it!
comment: I have been trying to download Kore since half an hour yet but it keeps on failing! My internet is working fine and i have got enough free space then why?

title: Kodoi
comment: Fantastic

title: great but what is send text
comment: how do you use the send text to media center?

title: Great update.
comment: Great update with regard to official Xbmc remote. Easy to use and beautiful. Also, it has auto detect media center host and themes.
Please make it easier to queue movies and episodes to play next.

title: Love it
comment: After tweaking port forwarding a little on my router and adding some exclusions for the firewall rules, it works like a charm. Very nice interface, useful and intuitive buttons - all that you need to remotely control Kodi!

title: Great!
comment: Excellent Kodi remote, and simple, too! Was using Yatse before. Would like to see CNTXT bring up Codec Info when media is playing.
Long press on the INFO button to show the codec info.

title: Just installed but works great so far
comment: A remote for my computer so I can switch songs all day.

comment: Testing testing testes
